name: Annapurna Base Camp
summary: A breathtaking journey into the heart of the Annapurna massif in Nepal.
description: Walk through rhododendron forests, cross suspension bridges, and wake up to the sunrise over the Machhapuchhre. This trek takes you right into the amphitheater of mountains with 360-degree views of the Annapurna range. It is a tea-house trek, meaning you get cozy stays along the way.

name: Everest Base Camp
summary: The ultimate bucket-list trek to the foot of the world's highest peak.
description: Retrace the footsteps of legends. Starting with the thrilling flight to Lukla, you will hike through the Sherpa capital of Namche Bazaar, visit the Tengboche monastery, and brave the thin air to reach Base Camp and Kala Patthar for the best view of Mt. Everest.

name: Rupin Pass Trek
summary: A high-altitude crossover trek featuring the famous three-stage waterfall.
description: Starting in Uttarakhand and ending in Himachal Pradesh, this trek is famous for its dramatic scenery changes. You go from hanging villages and pine forests to glacial meadows and a thrilling snow-slide descent from the pass.

name: Sandakphu Phalut Trek
summary: Walk along the 'Sleeping Buddha' with views of four of the world's highest peaks.
description: This is a unique ridge trek on the border of India and Nepal. On a clear day, you can see Everest, Lhotse, Makalu, and the majestic Kanchenjunga all at once. It is also one of the few treks where you might spot a Red Panda if you are lucky!

name: Goechala Trek
summary: Get up close and personal with the massive southeastern face of Kanchenjunga.
description: Located in Sikkim, this is a challenging trek that takes you through the biosphere reserve. The sunrise view of Kanchenjunga from View Point 1 is considered one of the most spectacular sights in the Himalayas. Expect rhododendrons in spring and clear mountain views in autumn.

name: Kashmir Great Lakes
summary: Arguably the prettiest trek in India featuring seven alpine turquoise lakes.
description: This trek is like walking through a desktop wallpaper. You traverse high-altitude passes to visit lakes like Vishansar, Krishansar, and Gadsar. The lush green meadows and maple trees of Kashmir make this a visually stunning experience unlike the rugged terrain of other treks.

name: Roopkund Trek
summary: The mysterious 'Skeleton Lake' trek offering high altitude meadows.
description: Famous for the human skeletons found at the lake's edge, this trek offers much more than just mystery. You walk through the famous Ali Bugyal and Bedni Bugyal, which are among Asia's largest high-altitude meadows, offering stunning views of Mt. Trishul and Nanda Ghunti.

name: Hampta Pass Trek
summary: A dramatic crossover trek from lush Kullu valley to the arid Spiti desert.
description: This trek is loved for its variety. You start in the green pine forests of Manali, climb over the Hampta Pass, and descend into the stark, barren landscape of Spiti Valley. It concludes with a drive to the stunning Chandratal Lake.

name: Kedarkantha Trek
summary: The perfect winter snow summit trek for beginners and snow lovers.
description: Located in the Govind Pashu Vihar National Park, this trek is famous for its beautiful campsites in pine clearings and a rewarding summit climb. It is one of the best treks to experience heavy snowfall and 360-degree mountain views without extreme difficulty.
